Class IO

    • Method Detail

      • spool

        public static int spool(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.io.OutputStream out)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Spools data from an InputStream into an OutputStream. Please note, that both, input and output stream, remain open after the spooling.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        out - output stream
        Returns:
        number of bytes transmitted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • spool

        public static int spool(java.io.InputStream in,
                        byte[] buffer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Spools data from an InputStream into an byte buffer. either until the buffer is full or the EOF is reached.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        buffer - output buffer
        Returns:
        number of bytes transmitted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • spool

        public static int spool(java.io.Reader in,
                        java.io.Writer out)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Spools characters from an Reader into an Writer. Please note, that both, reader and writer remain open after the spooling.
        Parameters:
        in - input Reader
        out - output Writer
        Returns:
        number of characters transmitted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • spool

        public static int spool(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.io.OutputStream out,
                        int num)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Spools data from an InputStream into an OutputStream. Please note, that both, input and output stream, remain open after the spooling. This method only transfers num bytes or less.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        out - output stream
        Returns:
        number of bytes transmitted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • tryClose

        public static void tryClose(java.io.InputStream in)
        Closes the InputStream in if not null and ignores a potential IOException thrown from closing the stream.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to close. This may be null.

      • tryClose

        public static void tryClose(java.io.OutputStream out)
        Closes the OutputStream out if not null and ignores a potential IOException thrown from closing the stream.
        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream to close. This may be null.

      • tryClose

        public static void tryClose(java.io.Reader reader)
        Closes the Reader out if not null and ignores a potential IOException thrown from closing the reader.
        Parameters:
        reader - The Reader to close. This may be null.

      • tryClose

        public static void tryClose(java.io.Writer writer)
        Closes the Writer in if not null and ignores a potential IOException thrown from closing the writer.
        Parameters:
        writer - The Writer to close. This may be null.

      • rename0

        public static boolean rename0(java.io.File src,
                              java.io.File dst)
        Renames a file to another. If the renaming does not work, it copies the content and tries to delete the source file.
        Parameters:
        src - the source file
        dst - the destination file
        Returns:
        true if the renaming was successful and the file at leas exists at the new location; false if the renaming failed. in this case, the original file still exists.

      • readUTF

        public static java.lang.String readUTF(java.io.InputStream in)
                                throws java.io.UTFDataFormatException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Read a UTF encoded string from an input stream.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        Returns:
        string
        Throws:
        java.io.UTFDataFormatException - if the input stream contains an invalid combination of bytes
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • setCWD

        public static void setCWD(java.io.File cwd)
        Initialization of CQ3 home. Either this method or setTempDir(File) must be called before methods inside IO may be used.
        Parameters:
        cwd - directory to use as current work directory

      • setCQ3Home

        public static void setCQ3Home(java.io.File cq3Home)
        Deprecated. use setCWD(File) instead.
        Initialization of CQ3 home. Either this method or setTempDir(File) must be called before methods inside IO may be used.
        Parameters:
        cq3Home - directory to use as CQ3 home.

      • setTempDir

        public static void setTempDir(java.io.File tempDir)
        Initialization of temporary directory when used as a separate component. This class has some functionality based on a temporary directory to use and in order to use that functionality without having an engine at hand makes this method necessary.
        Parameters:
        tempDir - temporary directory to use

        Returns:

      • isParent

        public static boolean isParent(java.io.File parent,
                               java.io.File child)
        Return a flag indicating whether a file is the parent of another file
        Parameters:
        parent - parent file
        child - child file
        Returns:
        true if parent is parent of child, otherwise false

      • createTempFile

        public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.util.Collection tracker)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create a temporary file and add it to the given tracker
        Parameters:
        tracker - collection that is use to record the generated temp file.
        Returns:
        a new temporary file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • createTempFile

        public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.util.Collection tracker,
                                          java.lang.String prefix,
                                          java.lang.String suffix)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create a temporary file and add it to the given tracker
        Parameters:
        tracker - collection that is use to record the generated temp file.
        prefix - the prefix for the temporary file
        suffix - the suffix for the temporary file
        Returns:
        a new temp file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • createTempFile

        public static java.io.File createTempFile()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create a temporary file in the generic tmp directory.
        Returns:
        a new temporary file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • createTempFile

        public static java.io.File createTempFile(java.lang.String prefix,
                                          java.lang.String suffix)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create a temporary file in the generic tmp directory.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix for the file
        suffix - the suffix for the file
        Returns:
        a new temporary file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the prefix argument contains fewer than three characters
        java.io.IOException - If a file could not be created

      • getAbsolutePath

        public static java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String path)
        returns an absolute path regarding the cq3 home as cwd. If the path already is absolute, this string itself is returned.
        Parameters:
        path - the relative path
        Returns:
        an absolute path

      • getAbsoluteFile

        public static java.io.File getAbsoluteFile(java.lang.String path)
        returns an absolute file regarding the cq3 home as cwd.
        Parameters:
        path - the relative path
        Returns:
        a new file pointing to the absolute path

      • rename

        public static boolean rename(java.io.File src,
                             java.io.File dst)
        Renames a file to another. If the renaming does not work, it copies the content and tries to delete the source file.
        Parameters:
        src - the source file
        dst - the destination file
        Returns:
        true if the renaming was successful and the file at leas exists at the new location; false if the renaming failed. in this case, the original file still exists.
